title: How to Make Strawberry Milk

methods.name: Simple Ultra Fast Method (Powder or Syrup)

steps.headline: Pour the milk into the glass about 2 inches/ 5 cm from the top.
Pour  1 tablespoon of strawberry powder or syrup into the glass.
steps.description:
If it is still a little weak, add another tablespoon. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8b\/Make-Strawberry-Milk-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Strawberry-Milk-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8b\/Make-Strawberry-Milk-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-Strawberry-Milk-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Mix.
steps.description: Taste it to see if there is enough strawberry flavor. Adjust if needed.

steps.headline: Scoop 3 or 4 tsp of strawberry jam into a mug, depending on how strong/sweet you want the milk to be.
Mix it together a few times to make it softer.
Add a tiny bit of hot water, just enough to make the jam liquid.
Fill the mug with milk, mix and enjoy!
Select strawberries.
steps.description: Old, mushy ones are fine too provided they are not moldy.

steps.headline: Place the strawberries in the blender.

text:
Simple Ultra Fast Method (Powder or Syrup) Ready your glass. Pour the milk into the glass about 2 inches/ 5 cm from the top. Pour 1 tablespoon of strawberry powder or syrup into the glass. If it is still a little weak, add another tablespoon. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8b\/Make-Strawberry-Milk-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Strawberry-Milk-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8b\/Make-Strawberry-Milk-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-Strawberry-Milk-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Mix. Taste it to see if there is enough strawberry flavor. Adjust if needed. Serve. Fast Method (Jam) Scoop 3 or 4 tsp of strawberry jam into a mug, depending on how strong/sweet you want the milk to be. Mix it together a few times to make it softer. Add a tiny bit of hot water, just enough to make the jam liquid. Fill the mug with milk, mix and enjoy! The Real Strawberry Method (Slightly Slower) Select strawberries. Old, mushy ones are fine too provided they are not moldy. Slice the strawberries in half. Place the strawberries in the blender. Add milk. Blend until smooth. Pour into glass. Top up with milk. Serve.
sentences: Simple Ultra Fast Method (Powder or Syrup) Ready your glass.
Pour the milk into the glass about 2 inches/ 5 cm from the top.
Pour  1 tablespoon of strawberry powder or syrup into the glass.
If it is still a little weak, add another tablespoon.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8b\/Make-Strawberry-Milk-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Strawberry-Milk-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8b\/Make-Strawberry-Milk-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-Strawberry-Milk-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Mix.
Taste it to see if there is enough strawberry flavor.
Adjust if needed.
Serve.
Fast Method (Jam) Scoop 3 or 4 tsp of strawberry jam into a mug, depending on how strong/sweet you want the milk to be.
Mix it together a few times to make it softer.
Add a tiny bit of hot water, just enough to make the jam liquid.
Fill the mug with milk, mix and enjoy!
The Real Strawberry Method (Slightly Slower) Select strawberries.
Old, mushy ones are fine too provided they are not moldy.
Slice the strawberries in half.
Place the strawberries in the blender.
Add milk.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into glass.
Top up with milk.
Serve.
